intro: Galium mollugo var. bernardii, commonly known as Bernard's bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and rapid growth make it a common sight in damp, temperate habitats.
